intro: Onosma mattirolii, commonly known as the Mattiroli's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, with narrow, linear leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Onosma mattirolii is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand cold and dry conditions.
